author: Special Correspondent
text:
A court in West Bengal’s Nadia district on Thursday awarded the death sentence to 11 persons in connection with the murder of a woman in a land-grab case.

On November 23, 2014, a group of men allegedly attacked and killed Aparna Bag and injured three others in a dispute over a piece of land at Ghungragachhi under Krishnaganj block of the State’s Nadia district.

The 11 accused were convicted on Wednesday, and on Thursday Judge Partha Sarathi Mukhopadhyay gave the death penalty to all of them.

Along with Section 302 of the Indian Penal Code (murder), the accused have been convicted under Section 307 (attempt to murder) and Sections of Explosive and Arms Act.

The land at the centre of the dispute belongs to the Refugee Rehabilitation Department of the West Bengal government and was being tilled by over 50 families.

Twelve persons were named in the police complaint, and one is absconding.
title: 11 get death penalty in West Bengal land grab case
